findings.title: Incorrect Display of Member Addition Status in the Frontend
findings.description: The frontend incorrectly displays a successful submission when adding members, even though the request packet is dropped (simulating a scenario where packet transmission fails due to network issues or other uncontrollable factors).

findings.title: Unauthorized Deletion of Boss-level Accounts
findings.description: The member deletion API uses the ID of the member as a parameter and will delete all information associated with the account if the parameter specifies a Boss-level account.

findings.title: Unexpected file type upload issue
findings.description: The upload functionality does not restrict file types, allowing the upload of any file, such as uploading an HTML file to the morelogin.com domain.

findings.title: Lack of Minimum Recharge Amount Restriction on the Server
findings.description: The recharge logic is performed by invoking a third-party page, and the server-side is responsible for validating the recharge logic. However, there is no minimum recharge amount restriction on the server.

findings.title: Source Map Leads to Source Code Leakage
findings.description: Source Map Files in MoreLogin Software Packages Lead to Decompilation of Unobfuscated Source Code, including TypeScript.

findings.title: Leakage of Sensitive Information in Error Messages
findings.description: Sensitive information is leaked through error messages.

findings.title: Lack of File Integrity Verification in MoreLogin
findings.description: MoreLogin does not enable ASAR integrity check, which means it cannot ensure that the app.asar file is generated by the asar npm package that supports ASAR integrity. Modifying the contents of 'MoreLogin AirDrop.app' and re-signing it does not result in any abnormal behavior.
